intro: Pouteria lauterbachiana, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces a fruit known as a capsule, which contains the edible seeds commonly referred to as Brazil nuts. These seeds are rich in nutrients, including high levels of protein and essential fatty acids. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
